label: Self-released
miniDescription: Broken Records remind us why they're great
excerpt: Broken Records trail their upcoming album with a new EP, Toska. Worth buying for the last track alone.

label: Something Something
miniDescription: This is exactly the kind of music I like
excerpt: If last year's Volcano Choir record hasn't sated your apatite for things-that-sound-like-Bon-Iver-but-aren't then Boo, Forever are a band for you!

label: LABEL
miniDescription: Not what I was expecting, and all the better for it!
excerpt: I find it all too easy to mock “surfer music”, but I'll think twice now I've heard Kim Churchill

label: Communion
miniDescription: An early contender for Song Of The Year
excerpt: Long-time fans rejoice as Matthew and the Atlas herald the release of their debut LP with the fantastic single, Pale Sun Rose.

label: Navigator
miniDescription: Finally Bellowhead capture some of their live spirit on a proper record.
excerpt: It’s taken several albums to achieve, but Bellowhead’s latest effort, Broadside, comes close to matching their live show.

label: Generator
miniDescription: Can Eliza and the Bear live up to their early promise?
excerpt: It Gets Cold is the new single from Eaten by Monsters favourites Eliza and the Bear, and it’s just as good as their last one.

label: Comets & Cartwheels
miniDescription: This has made me really angry
excerpt: There Will Be Fireworks have simultaneously released one of the best songs of the year and convinced me that they're bloody idiots.

label: National Anthem
miniDescription: Saint Raymond ticks all the boxes.
excerpt: Saint Raymond is the latest signing to singles-label National Anthem, but will he live up to the successes of his label-mates?

label: Self Released
miniDescription: Great sound from a suave new songsmith.
excerpt: Dickensian scally Emile Bernard has released a video for his new single, The Way.

label: Self Released
miniDescription: Sparse but not empty; a great debut from Ablu
excerpt: A thoughtful release from a quirky musician; Ablu's first EP deftly avoids the common pitfalls of “atmospheric” records.

label: 4AD
miniDescription: Daughter hit the nail on the head yet again with this excellent b-side.
excerpt: Youth has long been a favourite song of mine, but it's the b-side Smoke that makes this single worth owning.

label: PIAS
miniDescription: Are Okkervil River just going through the motions? It certainly feels like it.
excerpt: With such a good history of writing great songs, I'd come to expect more of Okkervil River.

label: Universal
miniDescription: It's business as usual for The Naked And Famous – which is good news for this reviewer.
excerpt: The Naked And Famous mark the announcement of a new album with new single Hearts Like Ours. It sounds just like their last record, but that's no bad thing.

label: Self Released
miniDescription: Great demos will hopefully lead to a magical record.
excerpt: If these demos are anything to go by, Oxford-based quintet The Sea The Sea are surely on the brink of making a five-star record.

label: Gadzook
miniDescription: The Young Knives forsake the traditional label approach and go indie; and make the best music of their career.
excerpt: Feeling hamstrung by the commercial and artistic limitations of the music industry, the Young Knives have done everything themselves for their latest EP, Oh Happiness, and look set to reap the benefits.

label: LABEL
miniDescription: Think “talk music” sounds like a bad idea? Think again.
excerpt: “Talk music” band Listener keep their unusual style interesting all the way through their new album Time Is A Machine.

label: Universal
miniDescription: Business as usual for Chvrches
excerpt: Darlings of the blogosphere, Chvrches unleash another straight-to-the-hind-brain electro-pop masterclass.

label: Downtown
miniDescription: New faces make new sounds for Cold War Kids.
excerpt: A shift of line-up yields good results on Cold War Kids’ fourth album, Dear Miss Lonelyhearts.

label: Canvasback
excerpt: Manchester Orchestra team up with Grouplove and EbM-favourites Frightened Rabbit for a special Record Store Day vinyl.

label: Demon
miniDescription: A nice curiosity for any Bunnymen fans out there.
excerpt: Former Echo And The Bunnymen frontman releases a live version of classic track The Killing Moon on 7″ for Record Store Day.

label: Domino
miniDescription: An important record for me personally, and a great record in general.
excerpt: The tenth anniversary of Rounds sees Four Tet’s seminal ‘folktronica’ album reissued in a double vinyl set.

label: RCA Victor
miniDescription: Another Record Store Day exclusive: free ink!
excerpt: Everything Everything give away part of their soul with their RSD vinyl release of Duet.

label: Atlantic
miniDescription: Frightened Rabbit go four-for-four in the ‘classic album’ stakes.
excerpt: For their fourth album, Pedestrian Verse, EbM favourites Frightened Rabbit hit the bullseye dead-centre once again.

label: Island
miniDescription: Another great electro-pop tune from Scotland!
excerpt: There must be something in the water up north; Out of the Blue is another stellar Scottish single, this time courtesy of indie trio Prides.

label: Oak Ten
miniDescription: Delicate, warped, fragile. And that's just the record itself!
excerpt: Keaton Henson treats us to another piece of his love-lorn whimsy with his latest single, You. Another Record Store Day exclusive release.

label: Pop Noire/Matador
miniDescription: I don't get all the fuss – Savages are just plain awful.
excerpt: Over-hyped, regressive, derivative, and simply terrible sounding, there's little to redeem Savages debut album Silence Yourself.

label: China Sea Recordings Concern
miniDescription: Lo-Fi pop treat from the depths of the inbox
excerpt: Summer Palace is the new scratchy, rough-as-sandpaper EP from itinerant American song-smith Virgin of the Birds.

label: Snowstar
miniDescription: A ten year anniversary release from a label I've never heard of before. Shame on me.
excerpt: A great collection of solid indie-rock from Dutch label Snowstar Records to celebrate their tenth anniversary.

label: LABEL
miniDescription: Mercury-nominated band give album away for free to build a career. Are they crazy?
excerpt: A year after its release, Sweet Billy Pilgrim are giving away their Crown and Treaty album as a free download in exchange for an email address.

label: Topic
miniDescription: A good record shop is not just for Record Store Day, it's for life.
excerpt: Record Store Day 2013 heralds a re-issue of the disc that brought us Davy Graham and Anji, arguably the most seminal English guitar record ever.

recordTitle: Charcoal Black & the Bonnie Grey/Shallow Brown
label: Song by Toad
miniDescription: Come all you pretenders and hear folk music the way it should be played.
excerpt: He's always been very good, but with this great new single it really feels like underground folk hero Rob St.John has come of age musically.

label: Drunken Piano
miniDescription: This is more like it. Real music on real instruments, and it's really good.
excerpt: Gondola run the gamut from breezy acoustic pop to rowdy indie with an assured deftness that's never less than charming.

label: Big Ship Records
miniDescription: The distorted bass in the chorus of this song is simply fantastic.
excerpt: New London four-piece Life blend synthetic elements with a raucous live approach on their debut single See The Light.

label: Self-released
miniDescription: An energy boost to pick your spirits up.
excerpt: New London band Shy Nature launch themselves with lively and energetic single Deadly Sin.

label: 4AD
miniDescription: By far the best album I've heard this year.
excerpt: With their debut album If You Leave, indie trio Daughter come as close to a perfect record as I’ve heard in a long time.

label: Cool For Cats
miniDescription: This is a year for ‘quiet music’ to become the mouse that roared
excerpt: Oh So Quiet have more bombast than their name suggests, but still confirm 2013 as a vintage year for subtle, thoughtful music.

label: Red Deer Club
miniDescription: Jonnie hits the bullseye yet again
excerpt: For someone so prolific, Jonnie Common’s quality control is mightily impressive. And what’s this? A remix I actually like?!

label: 4AD
miniDescription: Happy music for happy people. Yuck!
excerpt: There’s not much to dislike about Stornoway’s latest album Tales from Terra Firma, but it can be oppressively jolly.

label: Bella Union
miniDescription: I like the idea of this record much more than I like the record itself.
excerpt: There are moments of genius, but John Grant’s new LP Pale Green Ghosts still fails to connect on a basic level.

label: Self-released
miniDescription: Blues by the numbers, but it sounds pretty good
excerpt: European bluesman Emil Lager keeps it simple with his track You Will Kill Me.

label: Self-released
miniDescription: Why don't British teenagers make music like this?
excerpt: Precocious teen Spark Alaska could soon be the next ‘next big thing’ if these early efforts are anything to go by.

label: Merok
miniDescription: Definitely song of the year, but how does the album stack up?
excerpt: Deptford Goth's last single, Union, is one of the best tracks released in ages. On Life After Defo it's still a stand-out, but the album's no duffer either.

label: The Art Can Not Be Damaged
miniDescription: This music could only have been made by a New Yorker
excerpt: mike tyler writes songs that are one part sly intelligence to two parts batshitcrazy.

label: Self-released
miniDescription: Two great tracks from new duo Stay On The Bike
excerpt: This eponymous release from Stay On The Bike came close to being dreadful, but it's actually rather lovely.

label: 4AD
miniDescription: Finally, a song by Daughter that I can get excited about.
excerpt: Indie trio Daughter have been making waves in the blogosphere for a while now, but Human is the first song of theirs with enough energy to live up to the hype.

label: Cobraside
miniDescription: Eels return to what they do best on their new album.
excerpt: Eels go through the motions on their new record, Wonderful, Glorious. But when the motions are this good, who’s complaining?!

recordTitle: Do You Really Wanna Know Why Yr Still In Love With Me?
label: Happy Birthday To Me
miniDescription: A charming single from Joanna Gruesome
excerpt: Joanna Gruesome have a fantastic name and a fantastic record label. Their single's pretty good, too.

label: How Does It Feel To Be Loved
miniDescription: A lovely instrumental single from Darbishire trio Haiku Salut.
excerpt: Pitched between Mogwai and Yann Tiersen, Haiku Salut are a trio of Darbishire lasses with a mesmerizing sonic palate and a distinct francophile sensibility.

recordTitle: The Southern Wild / Upon The North
label: Generator
miniDescription: Eliza and the Bear do it the old fashioned way
excerpt: The split A-side of The Southern Wild / Upon The North is simply a good band with good songs doing their thing really well.

label: Self-released
miniDescription: Fantastic indie-electro from new band Dash
excerpt: Young guns Dash make a splash with a dazzlingly chirpy synth-pop single.

label: National Anthem
miniDescription: Joyous indie-pop from Aussie duo Atlas Genius
excerpt: National Anthem are a singles label with a good ear for a good record, and they've picked another gem with Atlas Genius.

label: Zorch Factory
miniDescription: The most interesting record I've heard this year
excerpt: This music is new, this music is effortless, this music is important. These Are Them?

label: LABEL
miniDescription: XX
excerpt: REMEMBER_MARKUP

label: Self-released
excerpt: Here's some lively, cheerful and remarkably assured pop music for you.

label: Self-released
excerpt: Imagine if Robin Pecknold actually liked music, had a decent drummer, and was more interested in rocking out than appearing fey and ethereal. That's Port Isla.

label: Saddle Creek
excerpt: An eleven year anniversary seems an unusual occasion for an extravagant box-set reissue, but that hasn't stopped the folks at Saddle Creek from doing just that.

label: Self-released
excerpt: Theatre Is Evil is taught and spiky and entertaining, but just too strident and earnest to be genuinely great.

label: Racquet Records
miniDescription: A summer hit all year round.
excerpt: Dan Croll gives blasts out of nowhere to the top of the pile with his track From Nowhere.

label: Everybody's Stalking
excerpt: Simple, evocative, powerful; Monument Valley certainly know how to turn a phrase that’s sure to draw me in.

label: OMG Music
miniDescription: This is one band wagon I'll be proud to say I jumped on as soon as I was able.
excerpt: Emily And The Woods fall just short of the delicate and mystical alchemy that goes into capturing a great live performer 'on tape'.

label: FatCat
miniDescription: EbM favourites keep it up with a stellar third album.
excerpt: So what's the verdict? Is the most hotly anticipated LP of 2010 worth the wait? Does it deliver? Yes it bloody does.

recordTitle: William Henry Miller pt. I & II
label: Song by Toad
Self-released
excerpt: I'm not normally a fan of husky, honeyed vocals but in this instance I feel I must make an exception.

miniDescription: XX
